review: We decided to go to one of our favorite places (chillis) on a Friday night. It was very busy, so our wait was about 20 minutes.  The staff was friendly, but we didn't get a refill the entire time we were there, I understand it was busy but come on now.  The food was good as always, no complaints. I had the honey chipotle ribs, they were very tender and so good, along with the French fries that are always great.  My husband had the loaded chicken bites, he wasn't a fan of the white sauce that was on them.  And of course we had the Texas cheese fries as an appetizer and they were great.

My first time at Chili's was here and it was surprisingly great!  Wifey and I came here on a Sunday after a quick Target run and everything we ordered was fantastic! My margarita was tasty, chips and guacamole were fresh, and the margarita chicken and cajun chicken pasta we ordered was definitely on point.  I would recommend coming early because this place gets swamped right at dinner time. I just came here again two weeks ago and got the same waiter and great service.  Move over TGI Friday's, Chii's is now the best spot for a happy hour on Sunday in my book.

Our server, 'Paul' was outstanding. He explained, offered and clearly communicated before, during and after our meal. In addition, he reflected a positive attitude. We will return to our Murrieta 'Chili's", thanks to Paul. BTW, Paul works the weekends.  I failed to mention the food was very good, cooked to our liking.  Fair prices compared to most other sit-down restaurants. Thanks Chili's for having Paul represent you.

Went for Happy Hour with a friend. I am pleased to see that the happy hour menu has been recreated. They now have drink and food specials worth ordering. The wings were delicious. The flatbread was average. Of course I had to order chips and salsa. Overall I was pleased and will return. Great service is always a plus.

This is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. The staff is always friendly, the restaurant is always clean, and the environment is so family friendly. I visit this location at least once a week and no matter if I do a to-go order or sit inside it's great quality food with an awesome customer service experience. I've visited the #1 chili's that's located in Montclair and I can honestly say that they had nothing on this location.

We came to the Murrieta Chili's last night to eat dinner for my niece's 14th birthday. I usually would rather eat anywhere than most chains, but it was her birthday & what she wanted.   Last night's visit was one of a kind. I have never in my life experienced a ruder server than I did last night with Heather.  We were a group of 13 with a few kids included in that. We were seated by the hostess and then Heather came over to greet us and take our drink order. We ordered 2 lemon-aids for our kids (ages 6 & 8). When Heather brought our kids drinks, they were in adult cups. I asked her why they weren't in kids cups and her reply was "Big kids usually drink the small cups pretty fast, and I don't have time for all those refills" This alone shocked me, but trying to be understanding we went with it.  We then waited an hour for our food. I know this happens with bigger parties as I had been a server for many years. But, when our food finally came my boyfriends Smothered chicken burrito came out ice cold. It had obviously been sitting a long time. We let Heather know it was cold, and she offered to warm it up in the microwave. This is not okay. When Heather came back to the table she offered a new burrito, but as togo I told her we would like a warm one for here. We didn't go out to eat to have a microwave burrito or warm food packed in a togo box.  We tried to flag the manager down but she was running around like a chicken with her hear cut off, never making eye contact with any customers and never came to our table.  We paid & left. Likely, we will not be back.

Good food, excellent prices and great service. Chili's is our go to place. We would recommend it highly. We enjoy having Martell, at the Murrieta, Ca. location, as our server. He is always full of energy and positivity. You can't help but smile when he's your server. He goes above and beyond.

I'm a fan again!  Went tonight due to plenti/chili's reward and gift card, new menus is great. All the good stuff, burgers, ribs, crispers, new appetizers and chicken and waffles.  Got rid of some of those Tex mex items. It was getting to bee too much Tex mex and less hamburgers etc.  they kept the fajitas. They looked great too. My husband got the chicken and waffles. He was happily surprised. They were sweet and spicy plus he had half left over for lunch the next day. I got the guacamole burger minus the bun and fries and add salad. It was perfect.  Oh our server Cody was awesome. Great meal. We will go back soon even without gift card and rewards!!

Service was excellent, chicken and waffles is the best I ever had, favorite menu item now along with getting a Caesar salad, no ceases dressing with the blackened shrimp with ranch is the bomb love chili's.
My mom and I had lunch at Chili's yesterday. It was after noon so it wasn't busy. Our server was friendly and the food was good.

Amazing service by the best bar area server, Cody! The honey chipotle boneless wings were hot and fresh and sooooo good! I had a Chilis promo coupon for a free kids meal, so a night out for a family of 4 (with chips and queso) for under $40- such a deal!

Saved $10 on a good meal using a Plenti/Chili's coupon tonight. Yay for saving money on a date night! Really great service tonight. Our server, Rebecca, along with the rest of the staff,    provided excellent, prompt service.

We like Chili's but wish it was spelled correctly with an "e" at the end, in Spanish. Our faves are the agave margarita, mixed to perfection and accompanied with the steel shaker on the side. So it's like getting 2 of them. The dry rub ribs are always crispy on the outside, moist inside without all the sugar in a sauce and sticky fingers. Just our preference. Mango chicken dinner is satisfying, love their quesadillas and quesadilla salad is great. Don't order the pre-fixed guacamole as it has too much lime to keep it from turning dark, which overwhelms the avocado flavor. Next time we will try the hand made one at the table so we can control how much lime goes into it. Everything we've had has been good for a chain restaurant. You can call ahead for a place in line.
Celebrated son's 20th birthday tonight. Great, friendly service provided by Heather. Good food, nice atmosphere

Every time I come to this location the servers are very thorough and helpful. The food is always yummy! The only issue is the service is pretty slow sometimes, but for the most part they are on top of everything.

I had a really great dinner at this chilis, the waitress was very attentive, everything came out in a timely fashion. Everything about the service was just on point, not to mention the great food! I have been to this Chili's numerous times and will continue to frequent this location. Keep up the great work :)

I used to always love Chilis soup and salad. They have changed their ingredients and it was terrible. Poor service, terrible meal and for three soup and salads, kids meal and fajitas... $80. Never going back.

Honestly the only reason for my review is due to the poor staff and crap food. I ordered a steak but the sides we're terrible the asparagus wasn't cooked and the potatoes were smothered in bacon and chives.  Also waitress was very rushed and was no where near to be found to order a dessert so we left instead.

One of the worst customer service experiences at a restaurant ever!  I have been to this location before and was very disappointed but I thought I would give it another try.  It was about 4:10 pm and the place was pretty much empty, maybe 5 or 10 people in the whole restaurant.  Almost every table was available.  I waited for someone to acknowledge us and eventually a hostess came by and ask how many (2) and she said she would be right back.  I waited, and waited, and waited but she was nowhere in sight.  In the meantime, numerous servers walked by and didn't even acknowledge me, or ask if I was being helped.  I finally saw the hostess chatting with one of the servers but she was in no rush to get back to me.  I was just about to leave when the hostess returned just as I was ready to leave.  I was pretty upset so far about the service but decided to just relax and enjoy my meal.  After being seated and reviewing the menu we waited for a server to take our order because there were so many around, but no such luck.  A few people came in and so now there were 3 tables in the entire area with customers.  The people that came after me were greeted by their server and again I was becoming frustrated.  Finally a server came by and took our drink order and said she would be right back.  By now we have been there for a 1/2 hour, at 4:40 pm and the place was still pretty much empty.  We waited and waited and after seeing our server having a conversation with a few guys, then leaning over to kiss him, I was seething.  Oh no, wait.. it gets better.  Then she sat down with them.  I was done, shocked that a owner or manager would allow this type of service.  Maybe they didn't care about one customer, maybe they lost a lot more. I have had amazing service and food at other Chili's locations. No wonder their parking lot is always empty.  You don't see that at any other location.

I'm not a big fan of most chains but with two kids with you, sometimes it's better to go to a chain than to go to some fast food place. I took my daughters here after the movies and the kids were given crayons and coloring paper to keep quiet. It helped me decide what I want to order.  I got the fatijas bowl with a fresco salad and my kids got the pizza and grilled chicken burgers with broccoli. I've been to many Chili's, but this was nice that I can now pay right at my table with the little machine on the table. Getting progressive, Chili;s, I like it.

My daughter and love going to Chili's the food is good. However the services Chili's murrieta are horrible from the lazy hosting and the poor bussing. The vary slow service was not helpful either. We sat down to we order our food at the same time as our drinks almost an hour later our food came out. Now I am not one to write a bad review I am a business owner I know how important reviews are. If the store was busy I would been more understanding but it was almost empty. We will not be going to Chili's murrieta anymore.
Veronica is so scarred !! My first time and she can't hang !! Come in for a laugh  and a watered down drink

OMG...why is it that I always have bad experiences at Chili's? And why do I continue to return? Well, this time, it was because it was Christmas Eve, it was the only restaurant near the theater we were going to attend, and we didn't feel like dealing with crowds and traffic.  So, as I said, it's Christmas Eve and I get that it's going to be crowded...HOWEVER, waiting for our food for 50 minutes is unacceptable.  Especially when the table who sat down seconds before us, with a larger group, had already received their food and were putting their leftovers in to-go boxes before we even received our food. In addition to that, two of the four meals we ordered were delivered luke warm.  Ugh...the two stars are for the fact that our poor server was really trying and I don't believe it was her fault and the food that I tasted was actually decent.  Won't ever return though...and hopefully I will remember the prior experiences I have had the next time somebody suggests Chili's.
Worst experience ever!! Rude waitress bad food cold fries!! Not at all what i expected!! Wont return!!

Unfortunately I feel this Chili's is worse than most Chili's. The combination of overcooked burgers and chicken crispers, poor service that left us thirsty and waiting for refills,  plus the fact that our appetizer came out literally two minutes before our meals made this experience completely disappointing. No need to return here again.

Not one for blue collar establishments, but this Chilies.. kinda..  knocks it out of the ball park (Babe Ruth sTyLe..) I dont know if its there great prices? great staff? Or this heart throb Cameron Diaz look alike bartender by the name of Veronica...Idk but Ill tell you this! This place would crumble like the twin towers on 9/11 if this centerfold wasnt running the show behind the bar.

We typically go to this Chili's atleast once a month and have always enjoyed our experience there. But last night was just ridiculous. We love our dog and take her everywhere with us. When we go to dinner if we want to bring her we make sure to go to a PET FRIENDLY restaurant and sit OUTSIDE on the patio. So we are sitting at the bar in Chili's and all of a sudden we hear something that sounds like a dog scratching its collar. And what do you know; some lady has her toy poodle sitting on the booth chair at their table INSIDE. Last time I checked Chili's wasn't pet friendly. And no it was not a service dog; it had a pink harness and a flexi leash. Extremely disgusting.

Amazing food and service here.  The new special that has dinner for two for 35 with two drinks is amazing!   My girl was so happy and I was so full!  What a great night!   I can't wait to go back and hang out.

Sat at the table for 20 minutes, did not even get waters. We tried to ask for help and the girl did not give af and just looked around said she's not the one and went back to her area. Our table didn't have the tablet so we could order. So since no one wanted to address us,we had to leave.

So, Starbucks is being sued for not serving the oz. as advertised; shorting drinks on quantity!  Well, this place does the same thing. Ordered a beer, went to the restroom to wash my hands after work, came back and my beer looked like someone had taken a big swig from it.  I 'tounge-in-cheek' asked the bartender if she was drinking my beer.   Her response was serious though, "I can't fill it because I'm not allowed to."  "We can only fill it  till the head hits the top of the glass." So, when I came back from washing my hands, the head had settled to the point that it looked like several oz. were missing.  Really?  And you won't give me what you advertise (16oz beer) or even appease an inquisitive customer.  Not going back.  It had been years since I'd been in this location anyway and after all that time, this was my 'comeback' experience.  I won't miss it. This chain is going the way of TGI Friday's.  Two franchises with an old business model and older facilities. Oh, and why the two stars instead of one, the wings were really good; just to be fair.

In all the years since Chilis opened in Murrieta and Temecula, we have ALWAYS had excellent meals and excellent customer service-------always professional, kind and available! I do not understand how less than a five star could happen! I think that many people are too accustomed to drive thru's,  that some expect everything now or sooner! CHILI'S IS THE BEST!
Great service from our server Paul! Got my usual Quesadilla Explosion Salad, amazing as normal!

Was kinda upset that I took my gift card I got for my birthday to this place to buy a birthday dinner, my server name was Jordan not once asked how things were going not until the very end when he asked if he wanted to take our plates even after countless times on trying to wave him down.  I ordered a Ancho Salmon half of the Salmon was okay the other half was burnt to crap completely black It tasted like charcoal, once he finally came around I showed him and he's like oh uh I can give you a discount. He gave me military discount a whole $3.00 off my purchase of $44 Oh boy after waiting 15 min for him to run my card he comes and brings my check back with no pen(place wasn't busy at all). Guess it's not important to sign or even give a tip to the nice hostess up front? I come here a lot it's upsetting but I guess I'll just have to drive the extra time to go to the one in Temecula.

I ordered through grub hub. Not only was my food cold and soggy but my hamburger was very RAW!  Who can't cook a hamburger?? Trying to get through to customer service with no luck. There recording says. " we're experiencing larger call volume than normal" you know why your service is horrible and will never use chilies or grub hub again.

My birthday dinner ruined! I saved a place in line for our fam of 6 via app. We checked in. We're told it would be another 15-20 minutes. They sat a few parties ahead of us while we were there (parties of 4 and 5) they finally called us... showed us a table in the middle surrounded by everyone (I have a 4 yr old) we automatically said NO. We seen another table (people had just walked out, table was dirty) told them we wanted that one. Manager walked over and told us he'd clean it right up for us right away... They made us wait by waiting area again(we thought hat was odd) we were waiting awhile... they then call a party of 2, then another party of 6. That fam of 6 also didn't want the table we first got offered, then we see them automatically sit them down on the table we were waiting for to be cleaned! (It was clean now) None of the staff including the manager  acknowledged us! It took for my husband to ask what the hell happened to our table. The two employees were speechless. I asked to speak to the manager, that told us he'd have THAT table cleaned for US!! they paged him, he came right over, and swore up and down that the fam was ahead of us! And if they weren't that table would of been ours!! Uuummmmm NO...That was a lie! They were caucasian and we are chicanos (in a restaurant full of Caucasians) we felt discriminated, that family basically wanted that table(that we were waiting patiently for them to clean) and they got it no IFS AND OR BUTS!! we were left waiting like idiots for them to clean a table... then lie that the other family was ahead of us! Let me say something... if that family was ahead of us... they would of gotten called BEFORE US... we were waiting for over 30 minutes! That family sat down to wait right after another party got called to be seated... they had been sitting there the entire time until they called them AFTER THEY CALLED US... FIRST!!! so to be lied to, ignored, and discriminated against... we walked out! Horrible experience... ever!!! We were all hungry and tired... my day went from being great... to being ruined! NOT SO HAPPY birthday to me!! We will definitely NOT BE GIVING THIS ESTABLISHMENT OUR BUSINESS! Due to Poor customer service and communication ANNNDDD horrible management!
Always have good service when I go to Chili's. It's a good neighborhood restaurant for American Mexican food it appears. Friendly staff and I give it a positive rating

My family goes here all the time and it's always great service! I sometimes use the To-Go option, and one waitress back there is so polite it! I believe her name is Melissa (could be Michelle!) but if you deal with her, you're going to get excellent customer service.

This is one of my favorite places to come and I ask to sit in Heather's section because she is so incredibly attentive and sweet and fun. I appreciate her service and will continue to come back often! The other review about Heather is so silly because she is seriously the best waitress I've ever had! Thanks for being awesome!

This Chili's has a gigantic open bar area that is almost half the footprint of the entire restaurant.  They have five flat screen TV's mounted behind the main bar and another 8 around the perimeter.  Full bar with five beers on tap mostly main stream beers (Bud, Bud Light, Blue Moon, Stella and Sam Adams).  Nice high ceiling throughout the restaurant give it a very new feeling. I ordered red the chicken enchiladas and these came out on a smoking hot plat.  The sour cream sauce  was awesome, this is a new item on their menu and is a really great Tex/Mex traditional entree.

This was my worst experience at a restaurant ever. First of all, our server Veronica was impatient when taking our orders (we were only a group of 4). Halfway through my meal, I decided I wanted to order the fried asparagus. Took about 10 minutes to get it but when I got it I realized there was a long black hair on my asparagus! We mentioned it to Veronica and she took it back. She came back a few minutes later to say that it wasn't any of the staffs hair because "it was actually blonde". Um no my entire group saw that it was a black hair, not blonde!! Then she proceeded to argue with us and accuse us of putting a blonde hair in my own food. Why would I go out of my way to put hair in my food and have to wait another 10 minutes for a new order?! I didn't even want the asparagus off my bill, I just wanted a new one, not trying to eat someone's hair. I then told her she was rude and she lost her tip and she said "I wasn't counting on it anyway". Just because I'm young (21) doesn't mean I don't tip well. I told her I wanted to speak to the manager and wanted a new server. The manager Silvia was very nice and understanding and I got a new order of asparagus but I'm still very annoyed with the experience and after being accused of putting hair in my food, dealing with an extremely rude and unprofessional server, and having to wait again for a new order of asparagus, the LEAST they could've done was take it off my bill, even though that wasn't my original intention. I will never come back here and I will make sure everyone knows about this experience and poor customer service.
Chili's in Murrieta is my favorite location.  The waiters are very friendly, large portions.  Love the  crispy chicken salad.

I went here for the first time with my husband and in laws we wanted to try somewhere knew. First let me say the service is very slow we waited close to 30 minutes for our food it was around 1130am and their were very few pple in their. When we finally got our food The fries were cold, the chicken crispers were a joke (you get better ones at KFC, and I'm not even much of a KFC fan) the ribs were ok but they don't compare to Bjs ribs or my personal favorite Lucilles.. Sorry to say but we won't be returning.

Went there for dinner with my two daughters at 8:15 pm. Sat down and was ignored as our "server" walked by us a minimum of 6 times in a span of 10 minutes. Never once made eye contact or acknowledged our presence. Same with the other servers buzzing around. That was  the start of a crappy meal and crappier service. I won't waste my time with details, I just won't be back. Too many other options to eat quality food than to patronize these bozo's. What sad excuse for a restaurant this place became. Years ago they were fine, today? Garbage!
Kristina made our experience phenomenal! Thank you so much for a positive experience and a happy smile! Definitely a fun time. Coming again for as long as she works here too!!

Oh my... I remember their menu being good.. But today's visit... Was amazing! The only reason it is not a 5 star was the long wait! Enchiladas, fajitas and my son's burger were all perfect! What a way to celebrate our first 16 years of marriage! Lol. The top shelf presidente margarita is excellent! Come hungry and thursty! Oh.. And a must have is the oreo molten lava!!

Let's not be frank here, let me just be suzie!    What's to complain people, eat ur food and keep those complaints to a minimal, God doesn't like whiners and cheapskates...I love chilis..great service...go to Europe and you'll understand how appreciative you should feel about how we get pampered here in the states

What a delicious evening we had.  Walked through the door and were met by Bridget and her million dollar smile.  Our server was Shannon, quick, polite and cute (wife said it was ok cause she agreed). Everything we ordered was as advertised.

This is the most dreaded review I've ever had to write.  This chili's is great usually, I live down the street so I come here every once in a while. The service was great last night, our waitress was awesome. The food was delicious. But there was just 1 problem. We were out on a double date with our best friends when we came here. We we were seated promptly and well taken care of. Our waitress was great, she made sure we had plenty of drinks and chips.  We ordered the panko onion rings to start out and chips and guacamole. Both delicious. For our appetizer I got the bacon burger and everyone else got Chipotle honey wings. It was delicious.  For dessert we had lava cakes which were awesome.  You may be asking what the problem is... Well, I ended up with food poisoning and have been up all night and I'm still sick. I don't know what caused it or if anyone else in our party has it, I hope not. But it is the only thing that keeps me from giving it a 5 because I don't want anyone else to get sick. Maybe I just got bad meat or something, I don't know. Use caution.

Let's be frank here, we don't come to Chili's cause the food is spectacular. We came here out of convenience and I am glad we did! I think his name is Cody? He was working the bar area. He was such a great server and enhanced our whole experience. Will definitely come back if he can be my server! Amazing.

We live down the street from this chilis.  We don't go here because the management of this place has been deteriorating for the last few years.    We decided to go back on a Saturday afternoon around 2:30; unfortunately, it was the same as it was before.  Walking in....There was only one waiter taking care of the busy bar area.  He was running around trying to take care of at least 10 tables. There were 4 tables that were not cleaned up and no busboy around.  Looking around the dining area, we saw a number of tables that were not cleaned also.  The place looked dirty all over.   We were told it would be about 20 minutes, during that time we saw only 2 waitresses taking care of the dining room.  They were working hard and doing the best they could.   In our experience, it is usually poor management that causes the downfall.  We could tell that this was the case because we never saw the manager out in the dining area or the bar area. No help for the workers.   It's too bad because we would really like to support our neighborhood Chili's but we would rather drive to Temecula.

I am not to be mean but Chili's could do better . I see a lot of restaurants that are more willing and capable In doing their job and serving ther customers.But Chili's I get the sense that the workers there does NOT enjoy what their doing.. What kind of restaurant does not make their customers feel at home? The employees are yet not nice at all.They dont even greet you! They have their own attitude like they know what their doing .Well guess what No tip.!

Let's be honest. It's the margaritas that I keep coming back for. I could sit there all night and just drink margaritas. But that wouldn't make much of a review so . . .  To me, the food here reminds me in some ways of pub food, but with a much bigger variety. They have a southwest egg roll that I could eat along with my margaritas, but I'd never be able to stop either one and end up as an obese drunk. I also like their flatbreads. They have a couple of salads that are excellent, as are the burgers and the fajitas. Unless you are a real food snob, you'll probably like most anything on the menus. And don't forget to have a margarita.

We used to go here all the time. Wait 20 minutes. Sat next to a dirty table (food, napkins, silverware) all over the floor. This was our view for 30 minutes! This is our 2nd visit with filth! I'm surprised that a restaurant can run this way.

Thought we would give Chili's another try after being away for so many years and the food was mediocre but our waitress was great... the food didn't taste very fresh and it'll probably be a few more years before I go back if ever?

Came for a quick lunch while running errands. Had the chicken flat bread the half size off the lunch menu with a bowl of chili. The chili was ok, didn't seem homemade. The chicken Flatbread had a weird drizzled sauce on it that was DISGUSTING and way too salty!!!!! I requested a new one which they were very accommodating and brought me a new Flatbread with out the sauce which tasted WAY better!!! I recommend they leave that nasty sauce off! We didn't get charged for the new one which was nice and they were very understanding when I complained about the sauce, so I am rating them 4 for the understanding and kindness.
Food is almost always good, but the service tonight was extra special!  Christine was the most attentive waitress I've had in a looong time!  Her service alone will bring us back!

This place is ok, if your wanting to eat something fast.  The food is good, I had spicy shrimp tacos and my daughter had unlimited chicken enchiladas with green sauce.  The tacos were good and my daughter ate all her enchiladas.  The waitress was irritated, rude and didn't have good customer service!!!!

Got invited there 8/23/15. Pic in the menu for fajitas looked great. Meal looked like its little brother. Not cool to be deseptive. Look at the pic but mentally remove the shrimp. You still have quite a meal. Now look at what came to the table. When the waitress asked if there was anything else I should have said "ya, the rest of the meal".

Had dinner with my wife here last night. Service was good and the food was fine. Something really irked me though. While we were enjoying our conversation and drinks, had not ordered yet, the Hostess comes to our table and start asking for donations for a charity. I find this completely inappropriate. They already have an app in there table pay kiosk that asks for those donations when you pay the check. For staff to come to my table and interrupt us to canvas donations, in my view, is out of bounds. I'm not appreciative of this kind of action when I am trying relax and just enjoy my company and a beverage.

always a good meal.  The service is usually pretty good when they are busy. I am always a fan of the skillet Queso which is amazing. Not toro much special to say for a mainstream chain restaurant. But this location is good. The manager runs a tight ship and the employees are all very professional and cordial.

Worst Service of my Life!!!!! I came in and had to wait when there were open tables the entire time. Than they sat me down in one of the tables that was open for. Ore than 15 minutes and proceeded to screw up my order. First they never brought out our appetizer than when i got my food my French fries were cold. The last straw was when the sent Diet Coke out instead of regular. They need to have more people working I dreading of cutting corners in service and making the consumers suffer!! What a Joke!

We go to this Chili's about once a month and it's really hit or miss as far as service. Tonight our server Rachel was amazing. Our food was FAST and she always seemed to be right there whenever we needed anything.  We went in because they had a $35 deal this weekend. You got an appetizer, two meals, two presidente margaritas and a dessert. We had the bottomless chips and salsa, the chicken fajitas and the toffee brownie sundae. The fajitas are good here. They're by no means authentic Mexican restaurant fajitas but the chicken is moist and flavorful. Our margaritas were yummy and we brought our dessert home. It was super rich and was more than enough for the two of us.

Wasn't expecting much, but it was less than what I thought it would be.  We waited 5 minutes to be greeted at the hostess stand, despite it being after dining rush hour on a Monday night.  Then we waited another ten minutes in order to be greeted by our server.  Yet another 10 minutes to have our server ask for our drink order.  We asked to place our food order at the time figuring that we'd be playing another waiting game for that.  The server seemed very busy, yet none of her fellow staff sought to help her out.  Our drinks were served and one of them was wrong.  Another 5 minutes before we could flag anyone down to get it corrected.  The food came and the meat I order medium rare came out well done.  Normally, I'd deal, but after all the other issues and for the price I was paying I sent it back.  Our server said she was soory and the manager would comp the entree.  The meat came back cooked medium and there was several pieces of gristle.  When the check came, I noticed the entree was not comped.  The server was embarrassed and apologetic.  She approached the manager again and he refused the comp. She was so sweet and felt bad, she took some money off the bill on her own behalf.  A very conscientious lady! I made sure to tip her well to cover her generosity .  Clearly the management does not organize themselves in a way that supports their employees.    My empathy goes out to the srevers there. Our family will not return to Chili's.

I don't like to be forced to use that kiosk to pay. I'm not an employee, so I should not have to do the job of the staff. If I have to do my own ordering and paying via the kiosk, I'm splitting the tip with myself, for services rendered. Other than this issue, it an ok place

So I just walked out of this place. My sister and I sat down, our waitress came by asked us what we wanted to drink and we both just wanted water, we also asked for some guac. 5 minutes passed no waitress no water. 10 minutes. 15 minutes. Once it hit 20 minutes we just got up and walked out. We never saw our waitress again after she took our order of 2 waters! I called to talk to a manager and sat on hold for 10 minutes before just hanging up. Terrible terrible service. I will not be returning.

If you go to this restaurant, be sure to get an itemized receipt showing the individual meals and drinks they say you bought, before you pay for anything. I went with two other family members and we each ordered modestly-priced meals and no drinks. At the end of the meal when the amount we owed was displayed on the table-top electronic device, it was higher than I thought it should be. But the only amount the device would display and print was the total amount; it didn't list the individual meals we were being billed for. I asked the waitress for a menu and an itemized bill, and she brought me both. The itemized bill (which she had to go get from someplace other than the table-top device) listed a 4th meal that we had not ordered and had never been brought to our table. I pointed that out to the waitress and she took that meal off the bill, claiming some other server must have somehow gotten on to her account and put that 4th meal on. If I hadn't done some math in my head before the bill came, I never would have discovered the overcharge. It strikes me as more than coincidence that not only was I overcharged, but they didn't give me an itemized bill showing the overcharge until I asked for it.
Terrible service. Takes forever to get your food and drinks. Food is cold. Ask for a refill and that takes a long time. Done with Chili's. Not going back.

Movie Date with the wife, we thought a late start left little time before the movie for much more than coffee and dessert.  After quickly being seated Our waitress Kirsten ensured us that the kitchen would be able to get out appetizers with enough time to enjoy a dessert and have us comfortably on our way to the theater without any delays. For the relatively short time we were there, we received great customer service and zero delays. Good Food, Even Better Service. Thank you Kirsten

I LOVE Chili's, it is one of my fav cheap places to eat. But this Chili's is TERRIBLE. We have tried it three times now, and each time was equally bad. I am not picky, but when you're sitting 10-15 minutes without being greeted, asked if you'd like a drink, then SOMETHING IS WRONG. It was not overly-busy and ALL THREE TIMES we had to wait for someone to even acknowledge us sitting. Now the cooks here, TERRIBLE. I always get chips and salsa...the first time the salsa was SO WATERED DOWN it wouldn't even stay on a chip. This last time we went she gave us barely any salsa, and all the chips she gave us were BROKEN like literally crumbs of chips. I let it go and didn't say anything. Then when our food FINALLY comes out, I ordered the LOADED boneless wings. I always get these at the Chili's in Corona, and they are BOMB with lots of queso cheese and tons of shredded melted cheese on top. These wings were NOT loaded, they were hard, with barely any cheese on top, looked like how the wings should look after a couple days of sitting in the fridge. All three times I have come the wings have been this way. I should have known not to order them again. This place needs some serious NEW MANAGEMENT, NEW COOKS, and ATTENTIVE SERVERS. My boyfriend and I will NOT be returning here, I'd rather drive the extra 20 miles and go to the Corona Chili's.

I like the drinks here, not a huge fan of the food. Staff is hit and miss as far as friendliness goes. Bathrooms and restaurant/bar area are clean. I keep coming back because I like Chili's margaritas.
Take out was great. Had a big office of people to feed. Kim the server was very nice she even helped take my big order out to my car!

Well lets just say it's been 3 yrs since my last visit to Chili's in Murrieta.  I will never come back . Once again bar area extremely slow. No one to clear tables. Have they not heard of a bus boy. Not enough waitresses and the waitresses do not advise you of any happy hour specials. I called from the bar area just to find out about the specials.  You would think they would have a happy hour menu.  Once again service extremely slow. My wife order a bacon cheeseburger waitress did not ask how she would like it came out bloody had returned it. Over all. We will probably never come back to chilis in Murrieta if you would like good service good food go to Red Robin or Applebees in Murrieta.  Endless enchiladas I would give it a 2.

Every time I try and give this Chili's a chance I'm soooo disappointed and wish I drove two exits up to the one off Ynez. Not attentive, you'd think you were asking for gold with to go containers God forbid to go cups! And once you pay your check good luck getting any type of service!!!

Went today for lunch after we saw a movie. I ordered the grilled smoked chicken burrito. Honestly it tasted like Taco Bell! It looked nothing like the picture. There was no citrus chile rice. It was a brown rice. There was no pico de gallo either. I didn't taste the side beans that came with it. Although service was excellent and our waitress was very, very sweet and super nice that was the only thing great. My daughter ordered the Cajun chicken pasta. She tasted it and said, "mom, I can make this at home" meaning nothing fancy. Tasted like jar Alfredo sauce. But we ate because we were hungry. I hardly EVER go to Chilis so I was very disappointed!!  gave two stars because our waitress was really nice!

Worst service ever. Server up front greeted both my girlfriend and I as "ladies". Fuck you bitch!  Okay. Next. Her accent was horrible. It was thick. Super thick. We couldve had happy hour in the "Launch Room". No thanks. I was there for the Reel Deal! Great deal - its honestly why we came. 1 appetizer, 2 entrees and 2 movie tickets for $35! Slammin deal!!!!!! Only to find out that theyre sold out! No movie tickets! Waitress couldnt speak clearly. I had to ask her many different ways about rainchecks on the ticket only for her to come to the conclusion after 5 minutes of reiterating later that indeed - you CAN take a raincheck and pick them up later. But after all the stupid people and stupid shit we just walked out. Fuck you Chili's.  Youre the worst. Your employees are worse.

Food was good.....when it finally came. Servers seemed stressed out and it was very understaffed. The bartender...well, maybe it's not the right job for her. Pretty sad when a entree come out before the appetizers....and that was after a painful long time. Maybe this place is under new management...if not, it should be. Long time Chilis customer and now a last time Chilis customer. Food is good....but I recommend eating a snack before you come because the wait time is rough.

Very rarely have I come across a restaurant deserving of one star, but tonight was horrible.  My wife and I just got back from this place.  Place was half filled and food all over the floor.  I know it was close to closing, but thats still not an excuse. When we were seated it was about 10 min before someone even acknowledged our existence.  A waiter from another section came by to take our drink order and told us that our server would be by soon.  Another 10 min went buy before that happened.  We ordered and didn't see our waitress again until our food was brought out. We ordered the pretzel stick appetizer.  I know that it is becoming standard practice for these types of chains to have frozen appetizers, but its getting a little out of hand.  The pretzels and cheese were acceptable, just shy of ok, and far from good.  I ordered a bacon ranch quesadilla.  I would have been better off at taco bell it probably would have been less greasy.  The quesadilla itself was void of any sort of flavor.  The only thing that had flavor was the pepper ranch and it was still weak.  My wife's fajitas were undercooked and almost cold when they came to the table. Our waitress was absolutely horrible.  I can take bad food or poor service, but not both.  we weren't given any napkins or place settings when our appetizers were brought out.  When we requested them, they were thrown at us as the waitress hurried past our table.  When our entrees came, they too were thrown at us.  When the waitress brought refill for our drink, she put enough force into it, so that the one drink slid halfway across the table to collide with the previous one. I will not be back.

I used to think that Chili's was really good, but now it's just ok. I feel like the quality of the food has gone down during the years. Service is a hit or miss... We've been here on two separate occasions. The first time it wasn't so good and this time it was ok. We went for lunch, it wasn't crowded or busy, and the server was nice. She came to check up on us a few times and was good. Nothing on her. The food on the other hand was bleh... My husband ordered a burger and he said it was good. I ordered the an entree dish with a beef taco, tostada, rice, beans, and enchilada, and it was bleh. The flavor was bland and all I could taste was the cumin. Presentation looked like they just plopped it on the plate. The last time we were here my husband got a burger as well and I got the salmon entree. And we felt the same way about the food. It seems like there's something missing. Overall, I wouldn't want to come back again. Not for the food anyway. The service was good. Greeted at the door and was attentive checking up on us. But the food and quality is bad. Chili's has gone way down. I'd rather go to Red Robin or something else by the mall. I'm paying about the same anyway.

Sitting here and the bar tender sucks. 8 min to say hi. 10 min to get our drinks and take our order. No personality no fun.  No service food came out wrong AGAIN. Had to get up to ask for drink refill. Do not sit at the bar if you come to this chilies

The Hubs and I come here regularly because they have the coldest beer in town. We always sit in the bar and get great service. Happy Hour prices are great and food is decent. The atmosphere is always good. If you are looking for a good happy hour with good prices this is the place.

If you get a chance to go to this Chili's on a Sunday afternoon, stop in the bar and ask for Ricky! Definitely the best bartender I have run into in years. Great Service and Great Drinks. Exactly what you want on a day out!!!

We love going here!!! We love the service, the food is great. We wish they would put a little more alcohol in the beverages but that is about it! We are a part of the rewards club and we loooovvee it!

Racheal and Patrick are our favorites!! Great service every time! Very fun place to eat, with delicious food at great prices. The team is always smiling, friendly, hard working and always recommend the best choices! Next time your hungry and in a hurry order from there grab and go menu that include healthy choices!

Shout out to server Laila for taking great care of our family. Loved the selection, and food was done perfect. Their kiosk for the rewards program and payment is handy, and the games were perfect for our 2 1/2 year old grandson. Glad I joined the rewards program, as 2 of our menu items were free after just a couple visits.
Not coming back here.  Cheap food but tastes like it too.  Bathrooms were disgusting.  Slow service.  Understaffed. Other than that, A+

Im done. Worst service twice in a row. First time manager was great about it but this time just did it for me and my family. No service and the only reason I am giving two stars is because the food is good and beer is cold.

This is more about the service than the food (actually my tilapia was good). But Martell was our server and he was as nice and humanly possible and seemed pretty genuine, it was an extremely pleasant experience. He's awesome. And Lyla was also super sweet. I don't usually care about chilis but I would voluntarily come back just because they're so nice. Thank you!
The food was fine but our server wasn't attentive. Our server didn't come to check on our food and never removed our cups.
Great food! Great service! Batender Cody did an amazing job! We will be back for sure!

Cody was on it tonight. If you come here sit in the bar area and request Cody. He helped us decide on food and drinks and was a lot more enjoyable to talk to than a lot of servers. Even better news: he trains the new employees. Don't know the cook's name but my compliments to him/her, food was perfect (it actually meets the expectations set by the menu pictures).

Sitting here waiting for my bottomless soup and salad.  Been here for quite awhile.  One would think I would have been served one or the other right away.  People that came in after us have been served their meal.  They'll probably leave before we get our food.  In sitting here, looking around, this place is a mess. Tables piled with dirty dishes just sitting there.  It's unbelievable that no one has bused those tables and the line to be  seated is ridiculous.  Under our table are French fries, and trash.  It will be a long time before I eat here again.  If the dining room looks this bad how must the kitchen look?!

Service was terrible.  Had to wait along time for the food. Could not even get the check.  Finally asked for the check and said we would pay on the kiosk. Waited another 10-15 minutes finally hostess walked by and I asked her. She was able to realize the kiosk I was looking at was not for my table and they got switched. Brought issue to the managers attention on the way out. Only a "I'm sorry." No coupon to come back or any savings on my bill. Seems like Chilis service at a number of locations has gone down hill lately.

We have been going to Chilis for years. We love the food and drinks there but the last 4 times we've went the service has been absolutely terrible!!! It takes forever to get our food and or drinks and no one ever comes by to check on you unless you're standing up looking around. Definitely do not recommend Chilis!

Stopped at Chili's on Cinco de Mayo. Wasn't too busy. Quite a few open tables. It was around 9pm. Was my first time to ever have Chili's, and honestly it was great. Well, the food and drink was great. The service could have been better. Waited a long time for our drinks and chips and guac. But, the appetizers came out quickly.
Lauren was great! Food was great! Bud light rita, bloody Mary, and a couple of chicken sandwiches to start the day of right
Just left Chili's in Murrieta, when did they start letting minors sit at the bar during happy hour?!!! That should be the adult section only, put them in the booths.

First off, I'm from out of town and I DID NOT choose to go here.  Second, I wouldn't EVER go here on my own volition.  Third, I didn't have a bad experience here.  I was in town for a friend of my BFs wedding and while the boys were out for the the bachelor business the ladies went over to Chili's for a few drinks the night before the rehearsal brunch- that's right: BRUNCH. Meaning we have to be up early for brunch and earlier for the rehearsal so nothing too crazy, at least not tonight, or yet. I didn't eat anything so take this for what it's worth. Just a drinking experience for me this go 'round, but they had 23 oz mugs of Stone IPA for $5. So, that was nice.  The bartender was v. young looking but maybe it's just the California living that keeps ya youthful. At closing time we asked around for late night options in the area and the servers and bartenders were all super friendly and gave us all our options along with warnings about what to expect at certain bars, ahem- Corner Pocket.  If I lived in the area i might be able to look past the part about it being a chain and see through to the shining $5 23 oz Stone IPA mugs every once in a while.

My co-workers and I came here for Cinco de Mayo solely based on their happy hour specials.  The margaritas were good and the $3 beers were also a big hit.  The bar was extremely packed and we were fortunate enough to snag a booth, however this caused our server to be pulled in multiple directions.  In the end it was simply too noisy and our glasses sat empty too long, we left shortly after.  My only tip would be to have more servers on the floor for days such as Cinco de Mayo.

It took forty five minute to get our orderves in the bar tonight. Asked about our order and the waitress walked by 3 times without making eye contact, the manager finally walked our food over with an apology but did not offer free chips and salsa or discounted drinks. Also the ckicken tacos are exactly the same as taco bell , just served on a plate. This place is off our datenight list. Should have a zero star selection.

I always get the same thing at Chilis but this time I went for their slider burgers. They were delicious! The food is typically good, but the service is sometimes spotty. Recently Chilis introduced a new payment option, pay at the table. I refuse to use it, and finding someone to swipe my card is sometimes difficult. Overall 4 stars, hopefully they go back to a regular payment method!

The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars instead of 1 is because the service was good. Our waitress was a sweetheart. However the quality of food here has drastically depreciated. This is the third time I've been to Chilis and have left feeling like I wasted my money. I used to love Chilis but sadly it's just not what it used to be. The food does not taste fresh at all, and seems to be of poor quality. Unless they start serving QUALITY food, I will never return to Chilis.

While visiting family we decided to stop here for a quick lunch. We sat at the bar and my sis and I shared a new chicken sandwich that was on the menu. The bartender was really busy but worked quirky and accurately, he was nice enough to offer to split the order for us. The food was delicious and the service was fast. I felt bad cuz the poor guy was all alone serving everyone sitting in the bar area during a busy Saturday lunch rush. I recommend this place for a good reasonably priced meal.

Honestly we come here for happy hour and normally we always had a bigger super nice guy and we loved coming to see. Now, there is this guy who acts like he is on drugs who is super rude and edgy.  There were servers there that were off drinking and he was over there talking to him the whole time. Drug screen employees please he my snap and hurt someone honestly that's how edgy he is.
So we came here again. Waited for almost 10 minutes for anyone to take our drink order. Service is super slow.

Well, what can I say if I am going to spend 1 hour and 40 minutes at a restaurant it better be worth it. When we finally got our food it was barely warm. Our waitress was friendly and sweet, but the wait time for food was ridiculous. My son ordered soup and salad, but they didn't have the soup he wanted made yet?  This is not the first time I have experienced slow service here- sorry Chilis I won't be back- your food and service have gone down a lot in the past couple of years- what a bummer because I use to really like you
The food is always pretty good, the service is also really good. I love the touch pad pay and order system, really saves a ton of time.

While in general I do enjoy Chili's, this location seems to be about a star lower than other local Chili's restaurants. I have been here a few times now, and each time it is ok, but not great. For some reason, whenever I get a a Chili's gift card for Christmas I tend to come to this location. Not quite sure why, but if I ever do get another gift card I will be going to the Temecula location from now on.
Clearly understaffed for a Sunday night!! I've been waiting 45' for the food and the server is nowhere to be seen!

So I was invited by a friend to grab a couple drinks at chili's this evening. Things started off rather well and I decided to order myself the triple dipper appetizer. After waiting for about twenty five minutes I spoke with our waiter asking what was going on with my request, immediately the look on his face was "oh shit". He had forgotten to put in my order. So after avoiding my table to dodge further questioning by myself, I sat impatiently waiting not only for my food but also to order another drink as mine had been sitting empty for about ten minutes. It finally came out, 45 minutes later. When it was time to pay for the bill I could not just sit there without expressing my feelings towards the staff. I mentioned my predicament to the bartender and immediately he gave me attitude as if I was in the wrong. He requested the manager and she made me wait fifteen minutes before coming to speak with me. Finally she came up to me and instead of welcoming me with a positive attitude I was given the look of someone who felt bothered. It was as if I had been deemed a complete burden and that me informing her about my poor service was a nuisance to her. She told me she would "see what she could do". After waiting yet another ten minutes, she returned stating that she will take five dollars off my fifty dollar tab. Needless to say I will never be returning to chili's again! I was not even given an apology for their error just more and more attitude by employees. This establishment is by no means professional in any way shape or form. My advice, you're better of cooking for yourself!

Good food and great service. We went for lunch at 1:00 and ended up staying until after 4 just chatting.  Our sever was very accommodating and didn't rush us out even though we had stayed far too long... she even kept refilling our iced tea. Thanks! Service here is great.

Yum! I have been to many Chilis restaurants, but I gotta say, the service at this particular one was awesome. Very friendly and attentive! I had the mini burgers which were scrumtrulescent. Good stuff, good times!

WHYYY DID CHILI'S REMOVE ALL THE SAUCES AND LEAVE THE BUFFALO BBQ SAUCE. WHY. Honey bbq sauce was amazing, same with the honey chipotle sauce. There is no point in coming back for 50 cent wings if there is no selection of sauces to choose from. You're losin' business! Sad days.

Today, I ordered online for a friend and I at work. First, we got one fork... for two entrees. Second, my friend's bbq sauce that normally comes with the sandwich was missing. Last, and probably the thing that pissed me off most... I had NO dressing on my salad. WTF Chili's?!

Happy Hour all day Sunday!  $3.99 for large drafts and free chips and salsa.  We tried the full order of boneless wings for $4.99 which were good.  My daughter had shrimp tacos which she liked and I had a Avacado Swiss burger which I was a little bummed was well done.  The place was packed but we had good service.  Great deals, just ask how patrons want burger cooked.

I visit the Murrieta, CA chili's approximately once to twice per month. The service is always great & the food always tastes great!  My only complaint is that on a couple instances the desserts tasted like freezer burn.

We visited this Chili's a few weeks ago with a large group and the Manager John was beyond "Awesome".  He made sure we were all taken care of.  Our waitress and everyone else who helped were very attentive to all our requests.  The food was served hot, and delicious.  Even several "special requests" on food preparation were handled perfectly and with smiles and fantastic attitudes.  My impression is, this is a "Team Effort" and the guest(s) are number one here!  I'm not sure if all Chili's are this great but this "Team" loves to work together and they all pitch in to make it happen.  A Huge Thank You and much Appreciation to John, he is a "real" Manager who pitches in and isn't above helping the "Team".  In my experience, if you have a great Manager, the employees are happy and work well together...this Team sure did.  We will definitely be back.  If I could give this 6 Stars or more, I would.
Consistent, decent food that you would expect from a chain.  Good service.
$6.29 for a single chicken breast? No way. The chips were allll crumbs, and they made the Skillet Queso smaller. Pretty disappointed.

My Chili's in Murrieta, CA, next to the California Oaks Movie Experience, ROCKS! Nearly every time we go to the movies on Date Night Friday Night, we swing over to My Chili's afterwards for a '2 for $20' deal and get all the chips and salsa we can eat!!  It's awesome!!!  This past Date Night, we took two other couples with us and had a great time unwinding with friends. Cody took great care of us and really made the night a positive, memorable experience!!!! Keep up the great work, Chili's!!!!!
Busy place. I've Had better expericenes with Chili's. we eat here often, but nothing super amazing, just a chili's.

Annoying you have to go in, and to the back when getting to go. Applebee's has someone bring it to your car. The to go signs doesn't say you have to go in. Plus on a monday it took 30mins for a burger. In TO-GO.
Be careful....the suggested tip is already added into the total.  Dont make the mistake and tip twice!

Very poor customer service, the female manager working was very rude, not very good English, our server was great after they figured out who was serving our table 45 minutes later. It took an hour and a half to get out food, and that was after we had to send 3 different plates back because it was wrong. Happy birthday to me!

They are good. I like their new machines they have there. So I don't have to wait to pay. I can just add to my order or pay when I am ready to leave. I heard some people don't like the new technology. Boo hoo!! Get over it.

Tried the smokehouse burger, and it was amazing! Lots of flavor with delicious french fries and spicy pickles. Fajitas were ok, good but not special. Buffalo wings tasted ok, but not very meaty and also cost $10.. didn't think they were worth it. Service was nice, however food took a while to come out, probably short staffed. We have 2 kids, so that food ticket time is crucial lol. There were lots of good looking items on the menu, so looking forward to going again.

The food was ok. MY FAVORITE WAS THE PAZOOKIE I had. It was so delicious. The cookie was soft and easy for me to scoop my spoon into (of course while scooping some ice cream as well to get that delicious cookie and ice cream taste) Loved the desert.

Dined here three times & the service has been horrible and the wait is always 20 minutes or longer.  I only live across the street from here and I rather drive 15 minutes to another Chili location. Will not be going back --
Ricky the bartender, works his ass off! I sit her and watch him hustle. An asset to this place. *Good good too!*

Something has changed at this Chilis - it's just not as good as it used to be. The last 3 times we've been here the service and cleanliness of bathrooms had fallen quite a bit. It seems maybe the number of staff is less and maybe being stretched too thin.  The food is still good but not quite up to the higher standards of when we first started coming here. The hamburgers the last couple times I tried them were way over cooked to the point they were almost crispy. Anyway, this was one of favorite spots to eat in town. Not anymore.

Disappointed with the lack of communication between staff members. All I tried to do was pick up a simple Togo order and it turned into a 10 minute ordeal just to get to the Togo window which is placed in the far back corner of the restaurant with no clear indication of where to go, to get... Your TOGO! Haha slightly comical but I guess I expected it. You get what you pay for.

I really wish I could give at least three stars - but the description for two stars: "Meh, I've experienced better." is exactly how I feel after tonight's meal.  First, let me state that their re-decorating looked amazing! I really had high hopes (as I hadn't been here since Nov 2011)! Their modern style was refreshing compared to their original dungy look. The hostess sat us (my 11 year old son and I) immediately and announced who our server would be. Brandy soon arrived at our table and introduced herself. She was very nice and polite and attentive. She took our drink orders and came back promptly with them. We needed a little extra time to look over the menu so she left us for a few minutes. My son and I decided to try their "2 for $20" deal. Seemed like a sure thing. We decided on the chips and fire-roasted corn guacamole as our shared appetizer. Good choice! The guac was flavorful and we also had salsa too! Great start! So our entrees came out and they looked amazing! Our food was so hot and fresh! I ordered their Classic Bacon Burger with a side of the fries. I also asked for a side of ranch (for my fries). My son ordered the 6oz. sirloin with steamed broccoli and loaded mashed potatoes. My entree selection: The burger was cooked perfectly! The bacon was a bit overcooked for my liking but not "horrible". The burger did seem to have an "abundance" of shredded lettuce - a bit too much, in my opinion. Overall though, the burger was good. My fries though - not so great. They were piping hot but overly salty. They were fried to a perfect crispness - but the seasoning was overpowering. Eh...Oh yeah, my side of ranch was forgotten - so I had to remind our server. My son's entree selection: He steak was grilled perfectly as ordered (medium well). My son was raving about his steak! So much that he begged me to have a bite! So of course I did! Whoa! Salt City, USA! That steak had so much salt - I don't understand how my son could eat it! The steamed broccoli was flavorful - but over seasoned with pepper. The loaded mashed potatoes were just average, at best. They were piping hot but seemed 'old' (as if they had been sitting in a steamtable pan for several hours). The service was acceptable. The server continued to refill our drink selections (my son ordered the strawberry lemonade; I ordered the blackberry iced tea) throughout our meal. I noticed several other servers and hotesses walking about the restaurant and all of them seemed genuinely happy. Smiles and warm welcomes greeted every guest! Can't have too high of expectations from a chain restaurant; I expected to give at least three stars but the food drove the rating down to two stars. May come back, maybe not.

Usually we go to the chilis in Temecula but since we were in the area we decided to come to this one today. And like always the food is great but the service here is not. Our waitress did not smile once. Don't expect quality service from this location.

Small portions, I had the Buffalo ranch sandwich and it was literally a microwaved chicken tender (probably Tyson) With A Tremendous Lemon Tang Sauce On It and five dollars in the mall's worth of ranch plastered to the top bun, it was not even freshly microwaved it must have been sitting out for a while. As for the fajita plate, the picture showed a LOT on the plate and when my order came it was only one forth of what was on the picture and tasted nowhere near as good as it looked. I also tried the half rack barbecue baby back ribs, which was pretty much a bottles worth of barbecue sauce on some bones with a thin layer of meat on them. The beef nachos I also ordered were very unbalanced in how it was prepared: some nachos were covered in meat and some cheese, some covered in cheese and no meat. They weren't good either antway. Not worth it, Save your money and go somewhere else.
Slow  service but food was good. I like the ziosk self pay.

I've never in my life been treated so poorly. Today I found out that everyone is not truly equal despite your ethnicity. Tim and I came to Chili's to support Murrieta Mesa High school fund raising and watched everyone that came in after us be served.  We had been waiting for our order for an hour while others enjoyed their meal and service provided to them. After I realized what was going on I requested my check for the two lemonade drinks we had and left. Although they offered to pay for the lemonade beverages we declined their offer and paid for them ourselves.  I am extremely saddened by what has been my first Murrieta separation. Words cannot describe how I'm feeling right now.

Made us wait almost 40 minutes for the food to arrive, which was okay, I get it, things get busy. The reason for the one star, is that our Tilapia arrived raw. The gross thing was that half of the fish was fine, and then I bit into a raw piece. The rest of the fish was raw, really raw. In the meantime the manager arrived and apologized profusely, gave us the meal free & the dessert at least ended the whole bad experience on a better note. Probably not coming back anytime soon, except maybe only for the desserts...

The service is terrible. Our server is standing around socializing. I'm not coming back again.  We waited for 10 minutes to be seated in an empty place. After she seated us she didn't even take our drink orders for another 10 minutes and we didn't have any silverware and she just said "I'll get it for you" and we've had to ask her twice now for some silverware. The meal was okay it wasn't that good. Then I asked for a box and there was a hair in the box...... If I could I would have given the place a 0

The place is dirty. The women's room door felt sticky when I pushed it open, like a drink has been poured down the front and had never been cleaned. The kitchen floor is filthy, food shoved off to the side of the floor and it looks like it hasn't been cleaned in ages. Even the side walls were sticky. Our food was a little cool, made me wonder if we would get food poisoning. I suggest skipping this place and going anywhere else. The staff was nice, however.

They are good for happy hour and for enjoying a inexpensive sit down dinner! I have always loved chilis and everything about them! During happy hour in the bar, get free chips and Salsa and discounted drinms! The bar tenders are always enthusiastic and happy to serve you! Haven't sat in the dining room for quite some time so I am not sure how the other servers compare, but I do suggest sitting in the bar from time to time of you are up for a good chat!
They like to play a fun game here. They call it "lets see how long a customer will sit at a booth without being served or acknowledged before they walk out" about half a hour in my case.
Great margaritas. They took in a party of 10 at the bar on a crowded night. Very cool and service was great. Thanks!

We are a family of 5 and eat out about once a week. We were here last Friday night and had a great time. We utilized call ahead seating, so we got a table right away. The server was prompt with all of our request and the food was good. We love their classic nachos!
I have always loved coming here. The service is ok, the food is great and the atmosphere is nice.

My husband and I have "date night" every Friday night, and this is a hot spot for us! We love the food, and the service...some of the waiters and waitresses know us by name, and us them! Very occasionally the service blows, but more times than not, it's great!!! We get our food hot, and fast, our drinks usually never go dry, and we always get a little extra courtesy from them with our chips and salsa (yes I know they're unlimited, but we always get a refill right before we leave and take the rest home). If you aren't watching your caloric intake, you have to try their Cajun Chicken Pasta, it's crazy delicious and really well priced...speaking of price, that's another GREAT thing about Chili's, they always have such GREAT deals!!

Worst service I have ever received. First people who checked in after us with the exact same number in the party got seated before us, next the waitress got our drink order wrong twice when all it was, was all water & one soda, then we had ordered a 2 for 20 deal and on our appetizer we got chips and guacamole, the waitress asked us if we wanted a refill on our chips & guacamole, but then brought us chips & salsa we politely said we had guacamole not salsa, and she said oh there is no refills on guacamole, which is fine but why did she specifically say would you like more chips and guacamole? Then she said well let me get our manager, at this point we were still being nice just explaining our issue, the manager then said no one refills guacamole here and if they do they'll be fired, I thought he was being a little extreme by saying that. So we then said let us just pay for our salads and don't worry about bringing the rest of our food out. He then gave us a very dirty look. And was rude as we left. I work in retail and I would never be rude to customers or down grade another employee in front if customers. My mom has also been a waitress her whole career life, and I know how customers should be treated. Just a bad experience. I won't be back there. I have also heard a lot of other complaints from other people about this location.

Service was awesome, but our regular server Michelle (see awesome service) is no longer there. Ever since new mgmt took over a few months ago, the place became a weird place to visit with palpable tension in the air. The food was usually pretty good w/ chips and sals to die for, but without our favorite server, we see no point in returning...
Always enjoy the food at chilis, this one though has by far the best service
Classic Chilis food. good service. but its always busy! call ahead and you can put your name on the list!

My mom and i went for lunch today and the service sucked! I think our server had too many tables or maybe she hates her job! I had the chicken enchilada soup and this time it was nasty so i wanted to give it to my mom so it wouldn't go to waste maybe she would like it! I had to wait forever and flag her down for a spoon she never brought, it felt like we waited 30 mins at least for our food and our server never came to check on us, i had to ask a manager for my check and he didn't even bother to ask if everything was ok, he looked like he was confused. After she made time to bring my credit card back with the receipt so she could say thank you just to get a tip even though she was rude and didn't deserve it, i looked at her and said "i never did get that spoon" as shes looking at a full bowl of soup she says "o yah, so what was wrong with the spoon u had" did she really said that, and then she asked if i wanted her to put the nasty cold soup in a to go..Really..WTH..I know its not an upscale place but if u hate your job find another one. I could have saved my $30 and had better luck at taco bell..never did see a smile, don't worry i didn't tip her!! BEWARE..Long straight brown hair in a ponytail with blond highlights in a ponytail...I would have complained on the chilis website but i was so pissed i left my receipt on the table

Came here very hung-over on a Sunday afternoon. As football season had started our first dining choice (BWW) was packed so we came here instead. We found the bar area relatively empty and after eating here we figured out why. Our server had maybe 3 tables she was responsible for, so I know she was overwhelmed by any means. I ordered the premium bloody mary and carefully watched the bartender to see if he in fact was going to make it with Grey Goose as the menu specified. He did not. Instead he used Absolut, which wouldn't be a big deal except that GG is much better and if I am paying for it then that is what I expect to get. I walked up o the bar and he informed me that the premium was made with Absolut and after I told him what the menu said he remade it. We ordered salads and an assortment of appetizers for our meal since they had happy hour specials. Our food arrived, but no salads. I know they eat salad after the meal in other countries, but considering that I was in Murrieta, I was a little pissed. The manager had already come by to address the cocktail issue and after I asked about the salads he came over again. I asked if the waitress was new, which would be an ok reason why our salads had not come yet and was told that she wasn't. I told him I didn't want to get her in trouble, but considering how empty the place was they really couldn't afford bad service. He agreed and comped our entire meal. While free food should taste pretty damn good, this food was blah. Even hung over (when almost anything tastes good) I was not very impressed. I guess this is a good place to come watch Sunday football (since it is empty), but I won't be ordering any food here that is for sure!

This branch of the "Chili's" chain is great! I used to hate Chili's a few years back, but I firmly believe they have made a come-back! They all kinds of delicious things on the menu. Our waiter (Nick) was so attentive, even on a busy night. I crave their new smokehouse bacon. It has a touch of brown sugar and a touch of spice. I love it! They would have gotten the full 5 stars from me but the service waivers a bit.
The best, so much to choose from. You get an appetizer like chips & salsa or southwestern egg rolls and an entree like bbq chicken salad or mini taco's (love the chicken)or ribs just to name a few.
